node.title: Cricket South Africa reviews independant report on discrimination

node.content:
["Cricket South Africa (CSA) will review recommendations made in the final report of an independent ombudsman "with an open mind" after allegations the organisation had previously discriminated against players based on race.", "The report was compiled by Social Justice and Nation Building ombudsman Dumisa Ntsebeza after six months of hearings in which former players and administrators gave evidence of alleged racial discrimination within the senior national team, and around player selection and coaching appointments.", "A number of players of colour came forward and said they had been treated unfairly. Former spinner Paul Adams revealed he had been called a "brown shit" in a South Africa team song during his time in the side, including by the team's current coach Mark Boucher.", "Boucher has since apologised.", "", "
Mark Boucher. Photo: PHOTOSPORT
", "The report also criticised current CSA director of cricket Graeme Smith and former national team captain AB de Villiers for selection decisions made during their time at the helm of the side, which it said were prejudicial towards Black players. Both have denied this.", "It also said the appointments of Smith and Boucher to their current roles were flawed from a procedural perspective, but neither appear to be in danger of being replaced.", ""We look forward to the report and will engage with it and its recommendations in order to assist in ensuring that we do indeed move the game of cricket onto a new and different trajectory," CSA chairman Lawson Naidoo said.", "Lawson Naidoo said CSA was committed to considering the findings and recommendations.", ""We will look at the report objectively, having regard to our social justice obligations, and our duties as guardians of the game in South Africa."", "The report also criticised CSA for its efforts to expand the game in poorer communities and suggested more needed to be done to educate national team players on diverse cultures to improve the team's social integration.", "- Reuters"]
